text: Psalm 29
Praise to God for His Glory and Strength
A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 29 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Ascribe to Yahweh, O sons of God,\f + \fr 29:1 \ft Or “heavenly beings” \f*
ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.
Ascribe to Yahweh the glory ⸤due⸥\f + \fr 29:2 \ft Literally “of” \f* his name.
Worship Yahweh in holy array.
The voice of Yahweh \add is\add* over the waters;
the God of glory thunders.
Yahweh \add is\add* over many waters.
The voice of Yahweh \add is\add* powerful.
The voice of Yahweh \add is\add* majestic.
The voice of Yahweh breaks \add the\add* cedars.
Yahweh shatters even the cedars of Lebanon.
And he makes them skip like a calf;
Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild ox.
The voice of Yahweh flashes\f + \fr 29:7 \ft Or “divides” \f* flames of fire.
The voice of Yahweh shakes \add the\add* wilderness.
Yahweh shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
The voice of Yahweh causes deer\f + \fr 29:9 \ft A slightly different Hebrew word here yields, “makes the oaks tremble” \f* to give birth
and strips \add the\add* forests bare.
And at his temple all in it say, “Glory!”
Yahweh sits \add enthroned\add* at the flood,
and Yahweh sits \add as\add* king forever.
May Yahweh give strength to his people.
May Yahweh bless his people with peace.
